page.title: 14ECOLOGY
page.content: Our weather is very variable in both summer and winter. We have a lot of rain and a lot of gales compared to other places. Generally, our temperatures are moderate at all times of the year. Around our coasts live many species of sea birds. There is a large colony of Eider Ducks nesting at the cliffs of Compass Head. Curlews, Puffins and Crows are just some of the birds. In the spring and summer there are many wild flowers eg. Primrose,Bird's Foot Trefoil. Heather is dominant on exposed hillsides. There are many wild sea animals eg. Otters, Porpoises and Seals. On occasion basking Whales can be spotted. The relatively unspoilt countryside attracts many visitors.
